followups.why: to confirm the diagnosis as well as prognosis

patient_summary: The patient is a 37-year-old male who was found to have a right axillary mass and was severely thrombocytopenic with a platelet count of 2000 as well as having hepatosplenomegaly. The working diagnosis is lymphoma, however, the Hematology and Oncology Departments were requesting a lymph node biopsy in order to confirm the diagnosis as well as prognosis. Thus, the patient was scheduled for a lymph node biopsy with platelets running secondary to thrombocytopenia at the time of surgery.

missing_info.why_required: To determine current medications and potential drug interactions.
To identify potential allergic reactions to medications or other substances.
To understand the patient's lifestyle and potential risk factors.
To identify any family history of relevant medical conditions.

notes: The patient was found to have a large right axillary lymphadenopathy, one of the lymph node was sent down as a fresh specimen. The patient tolerated the procedure well. The patient was transferred to the Recovery in stable condition.
